siteMetadata.title: Homemaker Oxford
siteMetadata.description: A report on homelessness in Oxford, by Transition By Design

welcomeData.text:
Welcome to Homemaker Oxford, research in motion from architecture and design cooperative Transition by Design. We’re exploring how empty, underused and unusual spaces in Oxford might help provide decent, secure and truly affordable homes for people who need them.

Click through to our interactive map to explore findings from our three-years spent learning about housing need in Oxford and creative and community-led solutions to our city's housing problems. You can read the findings from our research, or offer your experience and expertise. You can explore our ideas for new homes in Oxford, or create your own.

Whether you are a housing professional, a homelessness service provider, from a charity or campaigning organisation, someone looking to improve your own housing, a landlord or building manager, or an interested individual wanting to find out more, we hope this site will give you practical ideas and help you think about housing and homelessness in a fresh light.

We know that a home won’t ‘solve’ homelessness. But it’s a good place to start. So come on in and get involved.
